website_summaries.verdict: The AMD A10-7860K is a balanced processor in terms of price, performance, power usage, and gaming capabilities. It's a good choice if you're upgrading a FM2+ DIY PC.
cons: FM2+ is nearing end of life
Other CPUs are fare better with general processing tasks

customer_reviews.title: Plenty Powerful for the Rest of Us
customer_reviews.text: There are those for whom nothing less than max frame rates on ultra settings on the newest AAA video game titles will do. For most of the rest of us, this little APU has plenty of power. I used it in a build to replace my wife's aging iMac, and it works wonders. I'm planning on purchasing a second one soon for myself.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Bayless

customer_reviews.title: It works great for me though at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled with the performance over my old Core 2 duo setup. Seems to handle consumer level video editing well. I don't use this for any gaming. The guy at Fry's said these cpu's are junk. It works great for me though at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Realogist

customer_reviews.title: Graphics are excellent for integrated
customer_reviews.text: Very capable APU. Graphics are excellent for integrated. Most all games are playable at low settings at 1080p. Some will play at medium settings at 1080p. If you are on a tight budget or don't need to play games games on "ultra" settings, this is a great choice. The newer models even have a better heat-sink and fan to make them quieter and cooler.
customer_reviews.author: D. Galusha

customer_reviews.title: value for money
customer_reviews.text: Most power efficient of the latest A10 APU, with all 8 GPUs onboard. Ugly looking fan, but it does the job quietly, I never heard it. For the price, you are getting better than R7 240 performance in a <65W TDP package. If you are not going for discrete, this is the best combination of CPU vs GPU at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Caravan

customer_reviews.title: Good All-in-one CPU for the money.
customer_reviews.text: For a casual gamer this is a good cpu. I play WOW and Overwatch and my son plays games from Steam with no issues. Granted I do not have it on max settings but the game play is smooth. You will want to go with at least 8 GB of system RAM. Beats having to buy a $100-$150 graphics card and the overall power consumption with the extra card you save money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Bates

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my parents PC, no complaints. Don't expect to do much gaming though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: For what it's worth, I absolutely love this compared to the one I had before. Now I can record with no problems, and everything runs smoothly including some of my more graphics heavy games
customer_reviews.author: Dyllan R.

customer_reviews.title: Very good CPU/auto over clocks up to 4
customer_reviews.text: Very good CPU/auto over clocks up to 4.0 from 3.7-Has very good graphics & Sound. Stock fan will cpu temp in good range for mid-type gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Shyrl

customer_reviews.title: along with being pretty much silent
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you get exceptional performance, and the stock cooler is more than enough to keep it's temperatures low, along with being pretty much silent. Among the best FM2+ APU you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Hawkshaw

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and fast!
customer_reviews.text: Great APU for my media center, quiet and fast for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Edward B

customer_reviews.title: Love my A-Series processors
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. I can run 3 monitors no problem and never have an issue. No need for a standalone video card
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Benda

customer_reviews.title: Runs cool and
customer_reviews.text: Powerfull Processor, cheap, could play some games at medium quality. Runs cool and silient
customer_reviews.author: joefox

customer_reviews.title: going bad
customer_reviews.text: got it back is September of 2017 and starting to go down hill this suck as i dont have the cash to replace it dont buy
customer_reviews.author: dk6 gaming

customer_reviews.title: AMD CPU's are the Best Bang for your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: Love the A10 Series Processors from AMD. Great way to save money on not buying a Video Card as the CPU/APU has it built in.
customer_reviews.author: A+ Certified

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome!! It is very good quality and it comes with great instructions and very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie o.

customer_reviews.title: if your are thinking about getting this to run dual graphics with an r7 250 (the mistake i made thinking that it was going to be
customer_reviews.text: If you are only getting this because you're not getting a separate gpu then pull the trigger because this thing can run most modern games at the lowest settings. if your are thinking about getting this to run dual graphics with an r7 250 (the mistake i made thinking that it was going to be like running crossfire) then I recommend saving the extra cash and going for an rx 460 paired with athlon x4 880k. more power for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Romo Malo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far works great. Still need to run tests on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Day

customer_reviews.title: Cold and serious
customer_reviews.text: Excellent processor. After using the laptop for years, I noticed that Maple Software (for mathematics and modeling) is pretty slow. i could wait for 3-4 hours waiting for the solution of the system of differential equations. So I decided to build my own Desktop PC. After some research I made a list which contained AMD A-10 7860K. I do not play computer games so I do not need a graphic card at all. And the power consumption of this little guy is rated at 65W which is good for AMD. Have not been happier with my desktop since the project was finished and I assembled my first PC.
customer_reviews.author: Veniamin Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Great, great APU.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. AMD is a great company and makes excellent APUs. They aren't as powerful as their Intel counterparts but these APUs are great. The integrated graphics work well and if you don't really need a GPU they are an awesome budget minded alternative.I used the A10-7860k in my AMD build with exceptional results. Also supports dual graphics mode with some GPUs.
customer_reviews.author: William Conn

customer_reviews.title: Completely Happy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor. Who needs a Zen? Low watt quad core with enough HP for me. On board graphics work well ( not a gamer) but enough to run some games, definitely great for media tasks. Which is my interest.
customer_reviews.author: sam600sx

customer_reviews.title: Above and beyond
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product that exceeds my expectations. I have been using and A-10 5600k processor for over two years and this was its upgrade. I love the new aftermarket cooler as it means I get whisper quiet performance without having to make a separate purchase. It runs faster, quieter and cooler than my previous processor.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: AMD the underdog! Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for a media computer with 16G of ram and a 2G Nividia card running Linux Ubuntu Game Pack (great os). And I can run EVE awesomely.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Cpu/Gpu combo for budget builds that need a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Cpu/Gpu combo for budget builds that need a little more power, but won't be dedicated gaming rigs. I combined this with 1866mhz Ram and an SSD and am getting insanely fast boot times. Overall I am very happy with the performance for the price i paid.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewL

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Plays all the games we need without lagging. Other desktop performance is very good. Not like a core i5 of that speed, but it's a lot cheaper and graphics are good for light gaming.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has turned out to be an excellent cpu for the price especially for a first time builder. The stock cpu fan is decent and it runs quiet definitely best bang for you buck.
customer_reviews.author: marnier

customer_reviews.title: although this chip is not edible, my friend insists ...
customer_reviews.text: although this chip is not edible, my friend insists it's a "great midlevel chip" that's what i get for going carb-free i guess.
customer_reviews.author: jetpackjones

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the same performance as the 7850k
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the same performance as the 7850k, but with a lower TDP. I have this running an HTPC shoehorned into the carcass of an old Nintendo. Ventilation was a challenge and this isn't quite the toaster oven that the 7850k was.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Zenoniani

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU at a budget price.
customer_reviews.text: Received the item quickly. It worked perfectly, and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Joey B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for no reason
customer_reviews.text: The performance is not comparable to Intel unless you count DX 12. I buy it only because I still love AMD.
customer_reviews.author: VeleSila

customer_reviews.title: Great processor.
customer_reviews.text: Great processor. Very underrated. Combine it with GA-F2A88XM-D3HP Motherboard and you have it made.
customer_reviews.author: SIMON

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my home theater PC. Built in video card.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Guzik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome APU, the integrated graphics card of this processor ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome APU, the integrated graphics card of this processor kicks the brains out of the MacBook Pro and iMac products.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade to my media box. Love this processor. Very fast and low power use.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: I use this in htpc unit and it is excellent. Also have a skylake i3-6100 htpc
customer_reviews.text: I use this in htpc unit and it is excellent. Also have a skylake i3-6100 htpc. This A10 I find much better. The audio and picture quality is much better than the i3. That may change as i3 drivers mature more but the A10 watching movies the colours are much richer. Watching Raiders of Lost Ark you really notice the difference in the cave at opening of movie but overall I really prefer the A10 picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: since the day I got it it didn't perform work ...
customer_reviews.text: since the day I got it it didn't perform work nearly as well as I thought. not sure how playing black desert online at lowest settings could make it use 98% of my cpu then playing destiny on lowest uses 100% I cant even use discord or watch movie and play ......
customer_reviews.author: todd lasseigne

customer_reviews.title: best buget gaming cpu Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good, fast cpu. i will buy again for future builds ;P
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Tschakert

customer_reviews.title: CPU fan doesn't have bracket
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with bracket. Frustrated that I have to wait even longer to buy a fan bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: More Pictures would help
customer_reviews.text: I miss spoke when I first looked at this CPU I thought it looked like the intel CPU which sucks on closer inspection it is what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heatsink doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Heatsink does not fit my board. processor fits and works fine. But they sent me a defective heatsink. One side of the arm clamp is too short!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Advance micro device AMD A10-7860K Black Edition A-Series APU with Radeon R7 Graphics AD786KYBJCSBX
product_meta.description: AMD Black Edition A10-Series APU Processor with Radeon R7 Graphics (A10-7860K-AD786KYBJCSBX)
feature_bullets: 12 Compute Cores: 4 CPU Cores + 8 Graphics Cores
4 GHz CPU Boost Frequency, 3.6 GHz Base Frequency
AMD Radeon R7 Graphics with 757 MHz GPU Frequency

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars168 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
